content:
Such a policy is not good for cabin crew nor passengers

FRONTIER AIRLINES, an American low-cost carrier, introduced individual tips for flight Attendants earlier this month. Tipping people for exemplary service may seem uncontroversial, particularly in America where it is widely expected in restaurants. But the reaction to FRONTIER’s policy has been overwhelmingly negative. The president of the Association of Flight Attendants, a trade union which represents cabin crew across America’s airlines, called the change to policy an attempt to “dissuade Flight Attendants from standing together for a fair contract [and] shift additional costs to passengers.”

Frontier’s flight attendants have been allowed to accept tips since 2016, but they were pooled among the cabin crew. No other major airline in America, including budget carriers, encourages flight attendants to accept tips, though staff at Southwest may accept them “if a customer were to insist”. It’s not a practice that Gulliver likes.

First, flight attendants are professionals performing vital logistical and safety functions, and not waiters and waitresses at restaurants making most of their pay from the whims of customers. Treating them as such might make passengers undervalue the work of flight attendants.

Second, tipping does not always reward great service. It often rewards characteristics, disproportionately. One study found that servers who were considered to be attractive earned $1,261 more in tips per year than those considered unattractive. Worse, tipping is a vehicle for customers’ prejudices to infiltrate into pay. Gender and race  influence  the size of tips; black servers are tipped less, and a study in 2011 found that for anything less than “exceptional service”, women’s tips were smaller than men’s. 

Third, it could make it harder for flight Attendants to negotiate better pay and working conditions. This was the main concern of the Association of Flight Attendants. On the face of it, cabin crew make decent salaries : $50,500 a year on average, according to American government data from 2017. But there are great inequalities, with the top 10% of earners pocketing nearly $80,000 and the bottom tenth making less than $27,000. To flight Attendants at Frontier and any other airlines that permit tipping, it might appear a way to justify lower salaries by forcing them to grovel for passengers to help make up the difference.

Finally, tipping adds yet another nuisance for the customer. A traveller could once expect a meal, a few alcoholic drinks, and a checked bag without having to take out a wallet. Now those things all require payment on many airlines, including on legacy carriers such as American and United. Being asked to reward a flight attendant for delivering those once-free items seems a step too far.

ex: v. 收缩；订约；感染

雇用合同
a research contract

to enter into/make/sign a contract with the supplier
与供应商签订合同
These clauses form part of the contract between buyer and seller.
这些条款构成买卖双方所签合同的一部分。
a contract for the supply of vehicles
提供车辆的合约
to win/be awarded a contract to build a new school
获得承建一所新学校的合同

合同工
I was on a three-year contract that expired last week.
我签订的三年期合同已于上周期满。
Under the terms of the contract the job should have been finished yesterday.
根据合同的条款，这项工作本应于昨天完成。
She is under contract to(= has a contract to work for) a major American computer firm.
她已签约为一家大型美国计算机公司工作。
The offer has been accepted, subject to contract(= the agreement is not official until the contract is signed) .
此报价已获接受，尚须以签约为准。

他们被指控违约。
to take out a contract on sb
雇凶手杀害某人

玻璃遇冷收缩。

萎缩的市场
The heart muscles contract to expel the blood.

The exercise consists of stretching and contracting the leg muscles.
此项训练包括伸展和收缩腿部肌肉。
‘I will’ and ‘I shall’ are usually contracted to ‘I'll’(= made shorter) .
I will 和 I shall 通常缩约为 I'll。
to contract AIDS/a virus/a disease
感染艾滋病╱病毒╱疾病

ex: adv. 不成比例地
eg2: His successors have typically been at least one of those—though they have disproportionately come from Wall Street.
他的继任者们典型地至少和他有一点共同之处— 尽管他们都不合比例地来自华尔街。

约翰逊对这项税的反感，部分是因为除了浴血奋战的不成比例的蓝领军人外，他犹豫要不要要求其他人为越战做出一点点牺牲。
For some diseases that  affect Africa, better drugs and new vaccines are badly needed, yet incentives for research and development are biased towards markets that can pay.

ex: vt. 劝阻，劝止

你最好劝阻他别那样干。

我料想，他的朋友们肯定都认为他疯了，有些人肯肯定竭尽全力地劝阻他。
To keep up a sufficient water supply, Phoenix is adopting an aggressive campaign to recycle water, replenish groundwater and try to dissuade over-consumption.

ex: vt. 使潜入；使渗入，使浸润

桑基正是追查他认为的一个大范围的骗局。 这个骗局不亚于一个阴谋，通过把一个冒名顶替者安插到白宫，对自由世界进行渗透和破坏。

ex: n. 麻烦事；讨厌的人（或东西）；妨害行为

我不想讨人嫌，你要是想一个人待着就说一声。

我希望你没有讨人嫌。

明天不得不回去，真烦人。

真麻烦！

要清除这些不引人注意的环状物很简单，你可以撒一些盐到海绵上，然后用海绵在环状物上打圈擦拭。
Now I was coming to realize that a lot of people baffled this guy, and that I would be next to become incomprehensible and .
现在我开始明白有许多人都使这家伙感到困惑，我将会是下一个成为难以理解和缺乏吸引力的人了。
